chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindy Beasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  
DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Complete the parenting class.    
Cooperate with all orders of MBCW and Children's Court.
Make sure children attend school.  Take the children to the doctor and dentist.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.

12-04-15/ Judge Ellen R Brostrom
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend  30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent. Credit for 1 day time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cindy Beasley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-04-15 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time in the HOC

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Complete the parenting class.    
-Cooperate with all orders of MBCW and Children's Court.
-Make sure children attend school.  Take the children to the doctor and dentist.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges.  
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Scott Phillips in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for sentencing.  Counsel informed the Court the defendant is ill.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call on 9/18/15 at 8:30 in Branch 40.  Defendant to bring proof of illness.  Calendar call scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court with attorney Scott Phillips.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 amended to Neglecting a Child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), a Misd.
On motion of the State, Count 2 is added Negecting a child, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.21(1)(a), a Misd.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant would like to enter a plea.  Court is in trial.  Branch 7 agreed to hear the matter.  Case sent to Branch 7 forthwith.  rmm

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court with attorney Scott Phillips.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Court is in trial and could not hear the matter.  Defense requested this matter be set for final pretrial and trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court with attorney Scott Phillips.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MB (d.o.b. 04-24-2015) unless approves by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 40.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.    DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON 06-06-2015. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Cindy Beasley in court with attorney Scott Phillips.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
